SHORT_DESCR.P: The BBC is launching a new multi supplier Consultancy Services framework, superseding the existing framework which expires in May 2018. The framework will provide pan-BBC personnel with access to a range of suppliers specialising in certain professional services.

Successful suppliers awarded a place on the framework will have experience and capabilities to meet all the BBC’s distinct service requirements for each Lot. The framework has been divided into five lots; Strategy, IT, Financial, HR, Programme Management.

The BBC is launching a new multi supplier Consultancy Services framework, superseding the existing framework which expires in May 2018. The framework will provide pan-BBC personnel with access to a range of suppliers specialising in certain professional services.
Successful suppliers awarded a place on the framework will have experience and capabilities to meet each of the BBC’s distinct service requirements for each Lot.

Lot 1 will cover strategy consultancy and the following service requirements — Corporate Strategy, Business Model Transformation, Economic Policy, Organisational Strategy, Mergers and Acquisitions, Digital Strategy, Business Process Management, Outsourcing, Broadcast and Media.
The Agreement shall commence on 20.5.2018 and shall expire on 20.5.2020 unless previously terminated.

The BBC may extend the Term by serving written notice on the Company not later than 3 months before the expiry of the Term, by exercising its option to extend the Term on one or more occasions for up to a maximum period of twenty-four (24) months. The BBC may exercise its Option to Extend the Term of this Agreement unless previously terminated.

It is estimated that the total value of call offs against Lot 1 of the framework will be between 11 500 000 GBP and 14 400 000 GBP over the maximum 4 year period of the agreement under this procurement. These values include an estimated 1 600 000 GBP — 2 000 000 GBP per annum for BBC public service and 1 200 000 GBP — 1 600 000 GBP per annum for BBC worldwide.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The agreement will have an initial term of 2 Years (plus two one year extensions at the sole discretion of the BBC (the “Term”) commencing in May 2018 and ending in May 2020.

Please register your interest in this project by taking the following steps:
1) Register your company on the BravoSolution e-Tendering portal (this is only required once):
— Go to https://bbc.bravosolution.co.uk
— Click the link on the login page to Register.
— Accept the terms and conditions and click ‘Continue'.
— Enter your correct business and user details.
— Note the username you chose and click ‘Save' when complete.
— You will shortly receive an email with your temporary password.
2) Express an Interest in the tender:
— Login to the portal with the username/password.
— Click the ‘PQQs / ITTs Open To All Suppliers' link. (These are Pre-Qualification Questionnaires or Invitations to Tender open to any registered supplier).
— Click on the relevant PQQ/ ITT to access the content.
— Click the ‘Express Interest' button at the top of the page. This will move the PQQ /ITT into your ‘My PQQs/ My ITTs' page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only.
— You can now access any attachments by clicking ‘Buyer Attachments' in the ‘PQQ/ ITT Details' box.
3) Responding to the tender:
— Click ‘My Response' under ‘PQQ/ ITT Details', you can choose to ‘Create Response' or to ‘Decline to Respond' (please give a reason if declining).
— You can now use the ‘Messages' function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification.

— Note the deadline for completion, then follow the onscreen instructions to complete the PQQ/ ITT There may be a mixture of online and offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available).

— You must then submit your reply using the ‘Submit Response' button at the top of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the Bravo e-Tendering help desk.

Tenders and all supporting documents must be priced in sterling and all payments will be made in sterling. The contract shall be subject to English law. The awarding authority does not bind itself to accept the lowest, or any tender and reserves the right to accept part of a tender unless the tenderer expressly stipulates otherwise in the tender document.
